newsitem.title: USA: U.S. manufacturers call for boost in Japanese yen.
newsitem.headline: U.S. manufacturers call for boost in Japanese yen.

text.p: The National Association of Manufacturers said on Thursday that the U.S. trade deficit with Japan indicates the need for a stronger Japanese yen.

"The persistent and growing trade deficit with Japan underscores the need for the U.S. and Japan to pay more than lip service to the problems caused by the rising dollar," said Marino Marcich, NAM director of international investment and finance said in response to February U.S. trade data.
Marcich said "cooperative action on exchange rates is only half the equation" and "should in no way detract from the desirability of deregulating the Japanese economy."
